title: CS Fundamentals Deep Dive Pre Survey

elements.name: question1
elements.html:
Thank you for completing the pre-survey for the CS Fundamentals Deep Dive workshop.

The purpose of this survey is to:

  • Help us understand how best to support your development
  • Help us understand where and how to improve our program

Your individual responses here are completely confidential and will never be tied back to you in any way. Your honesty and candor is appreciated. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.

As a reminder, the Deep Dive workshop is intended for teachers with at least some experience implementing CS Fundamentals curriculum. If you have not taught at least two lessons from this curriculum and will not be able to do so prior to this workshop, we recommend you cancel your registration and enroll in a CS Fundamentals Intro workshop.

elements.name: barriers_scale
elements.html:
Below, we ask you to use the following scale to identify the barriers that have impacted your ability to teach CS Fundamentals in the way you would like to teach the curriculum.

1----2 3----4----5 6----7
Not a barrier Somewhat of a barrier A significant barrier

elements.name: how_much_barrier_to_teaching_cs
elements.title: To what degree are each of the following a barrier preventing you from teaching CS Fundamentals in the way you would like to teach the curriculum?

rows.text: Time to plan and prepare to teach the curriculum.
Space to fit the lessons in during the school day.
Managing different courses and resources across multiple grades.
Support from school or district administration.
Support from other teachers in the school.
Knowledge and understanding of computer science.
Understanding the Code.org teaching and learning tools.
Understanding the course resources (lesson plans, etc).
Understanding the pedagogy for a computer science classroom.
Keeping students engaged during all lessons.

elements.name: other_barriers_fr
elements.title: What other barriers do you experience teaching CS Fundamentals?

pages.name: page2

elements.name: true_of_me_now_scale_1
elements.html:
There are a variety of teaching strategies that computer science teachers use with students in classrooms.

Below, we ask you to use a "true of me now" scale to self-rate how true it is that you have concrete strategies - techniques or methods you could name or describe to another teacher - for doing these things right now.

1----2 3----4----5 6----7
Not true of me Somewhat true of me now Very true of me now

elements.name: teaching_strategies
elements.title: To what extent do the following statements about teaching strategies describe you?

rows.text: I can ensure that students work collaboratively when writing code.
I can ensure that every student has a daily opportunity to share ideas and be heard by classmates through partnered conversations, small-group or large-group discussion.
I can create a culture in which problems or failures are normalized and welcomed as a natural part of the problem solving process.
I can support students in solving the various problems they encounter while working on programming activities.

elements.name: true_of_me_now_scale_2
elements.html:
Next, use the "true of me now" scale to self-rate your level of comfort accessing, navigating and using CS Fundamentals curricular materials and the Code.org website.

1----2 3----4----5 6----7
Not true of me Somewhat true of me now Very true of me now

elements.name: codeorg_tools_familiarity
elements.title: Right now, I know exactly how to...

rows.text: access teacher-facing lesson plans online for CS Fundamentals courses.
view student work through the teacher dashboard on the Code.org website.
access sample solutions to programming puzzles on the Code.org website.
create sections of students on the Code.org website.
manage sections of students on the Code.org website (move students between sections, reset passwords, etc).

elements.name: teaching_strategy_fr
elements.title: What is a teaching strategy or approach that has helped you teach CS Fundamentals in a way in which you want your students to experience the course?

pages.title: CS Fundamentals Teaching Practices and Course Materials

elements.html: The following questions are designed to help us better understand what you hope to get out of attending the Deep Dive workshop.

elements.title: What do you hope to learn in the Deep Dive workshop that will impact your use of CS Fundamentals in your classroom?

elements.title: Is there anything else you want to discuss at the workshop, or would like to tell us before the workshop?
